title: Game doesn't launch after Champ Select
body:
I just bought a new PC (AMD mobo, Ryzen 5, EVGA GTX1060), and am loading up League for the first time.  I install the game to my secondary HDD (SSD for my OS), and launch the application.  Game downloads and installs.  I'm able to go through champion select.  Afterwards, the icon appears in my taskbar, but no window appears even after 10+ minutes of waiting.  I've tried using the Hextech Repair Tool, but it didn't affect anything to my knowledge.

Someone please help, I gotta get some ARAMs in :(

replies.body:
Check your router settings to if you can. Might be worth looking into port forwarding. 
I had the same issue with failing to reach the network and it was cox's crappy router causing the issue.

It sounds like your connection is going into a dormant state after champ select, meaning it's failing to reach the game server.  I recommend going over the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide instead to clear up any blocks and instability that's causing this issue.  Test it in a custom to be safe, though!
Do you have any other advice?

Hi, thank you for responding!

Unfortunately, nothing I can find over at connection issues has been able to resolve the issue.  I've also uninstalled League from the HDD and added it to my SSD so that it would be in its default directory, but it still doesn't appear to work.  I have also run the Hextech Repair Tool since reinstalling the game.

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=wVsqdY37,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-08-05T21:45:16.048+0000)
>
> This freezing really sucks. :(  Your best right now is to stop queuing into matchmade games until this is resolved.  This freezing has been known to happen to some players after updating Windows 10.  Specifically, the [Xbox Game Bar](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) seems to auto-enable, which can cause this.  Disabling it should fix this up, but it's really important you test that in a custom game.

Also worth mentioning try updating drivers in the GeForce Experience app.
Thank you!  Unfortunately, I also have tried disabling the Xbox Game Bar.  I did not know about the GeForce Experience App, so I'll try that out!
